TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit BotAdapter extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents a bot adapter that can connect a bot to a service endpoint. This class is abstract.
Docs.remarks:
The bot adapter encapsulates authentication processes and sends activities to and receives activities from the Bot Connector Service. When your bot receives an activity, the adapter creates a context object, passes it to your bot's application logic, and sends responses back to the user's channel.
Use to add objects to your adapter’s middleware collection. The adapter processes and directs incoming activities in through the bot middleware pipeline to your bot’s logic and then back out again. As each activity flows in and out of the bot, each piece of middleware can inspect or act upon the activity, both before and after the bot logic runs.

The method to call for the resulting bot turn.
Docs.summary: Sends a proactive message to a conversation.
Docs.returns: A task that represents the work queued to execute.
Docs.remarks: Call this method to proactively send a message to a conversation. Most channels require a user to initaiate a conversation with a bot before the bot can send activities to the user.

Docs.param: A callback method to run at the end of the pipeline.
A cancellation token for the task.
Docs.summary: Starts activity processing for the current bot turn.
Docs.returns: A task that represents the work queued to execute.
Docs.remarks:
The adapter calls middleware in the order in which you added it. The adapter passes in the context object for the turn and a next delegate, and the middleware calls the delegate to pass control to the next middleware in the pipeline. Once control reaches the end of the pipeline, the adapter calls the method. If a middleware component doesn’t call the next delegate, the adapter does not call any of the subsequent middleware’s
methods or the callback method, and the pipeline short circuits.
When the turn is initiated by a user activity (reactive messaging), the callback method will be a reference to the bot's method. When the turn is initiated by a call to (proactive messaging), the callback method is the callback method that was provided in the call.

Docs.param: The context object for the turn.
Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, sends activities to the conversation.
Docs.returns: A task that represents the work queued to execute.
Docs.remarks: If the activities are successfully sent, the task result contains an array of objects containing the IDs that the receiving channel assigned to the activities.

Docs.param: The context object for the turn.
Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, replaces an existing activity in the conversation.
Docs.returns: A task that represents the work queued to execute.
Docs.remarks:
If the activity is successfully sent, the task result contains a object containing the ID that the receiving channel assigned to the activity.
Before calling this, set the ID of the replacement activity to the ID of the activity to replace.

Docs.summary: Adds middleware to the adapter's pipeline.
Docs.remarks: Middleware is added to the adapter at initialization time. For each turn, the adapter calls middleware in the order in which you added it.
